definition: to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: We can refund the full fare ticket for you.
sentences.chinese: 您的客票限制在原出票地點退票。

sentences.english: If the bus is late, you can claim a full fund.
sentences.chinese: 如果車輛晚點，你可以全額退票。
你的支票被退票了，我沒拿到錢。

sentences.english: We will take all refunding actiion finished before end of August.
sentences.chinese: 我們將會在八月底前處理完所有的退票帳款。

sentences.english: You might save money or even prevent the problem of a missing refund check .
sentences.chinese: 你可能省錢的問題，甚至防止失蹤退票檢查。

sentences.english: Otherwise, you may incur fees for overdrafts or returned checks.
sentences.chinese: 否則，可能會招致透支或退票費。

sentences.english: I'm sorry , your ticket can't be changed, only to be refunded.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，您的車票不能辦理改簽，只能退票。

sentences.english: Your ticket can only be refunded in the office where it is issued.
sentences.chinese: 您的客票限定在原出票地點退票。

sentences.english: OC has the right to decide whether to accept your application of refund.
sentences.chinese: 深圳大組委有權自行決定是否接受您的退票申請。

sentences.english: Please inform me if have return ticket.
sentences.chinese: 如果有退票的，請通知我。

sentences.english: I wont give you a check which I know will bounce.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能開給你一張會遭退票的支票。

sentences.english: I want to give back my ticket.
Refund for partial unused tickets will be entertained after deducting OW net fare.
sentences.chinese: 未使用部分航段的機票退票時將扣除單程淨價。

sentences.english: If you want to refund your ticket, we will charge you 50% of fares.
sentences.chinese: 如果您要求退票，我們將收取50%的退票費。

sentences.english: If you want to refund your ticket, we will charge you 50% of fares.
sentences.chinese: 如果您要求退票，我們將收取50%的退票費。

sentences.english: To refund a result, other companies have moved away.
sentences.chinese: 去退票，結果對方公司已經搬遷走了。

definition: to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
